items.label: def-revival-operator-formal
items.title: Mean-Field Revival Operator (Formal)
items.content:
448: :label: def-revival-operator-formal
449: 
450: The **revival operator** $\mathcal{R}: \mathcal{P}(\Omega) \times [0,1] \to \mathcal{M}^+(\Omega)$ (where $\mathcal{M}^+$ denotes non-negative measures) is defined by:
451: 
452: $$
453: \mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d](x,v) := \lambda_{\text{revive}} \cdot m_d \cdot \frac{\rho(x,v)}{\|\rho\|_{L^1}}
454: 
455: $$
456: 
457: where $\|\rho\|_{L^1} = \int_\Omega \rho(x,v) \, dx dv$ is the total alive mass.
458: 
459: **Properties**:
460: 1. **Mass injection**: $\int_\Omega \mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d] = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d$ (transfers mass from dead to alive)
461: 2. **Proportionality**: Revival samples proportionally to current alive density
462: 3. **Normalization**: The factor $1/\|\rho\|_{L^1}$ ensures the distribution shape is preserved

items.label: def-combined-jump-operator
items.title: Combined Jump Operator
items.content:
485: :label: def-combined-jump-operator
486: 
487: Define the **jump operator** $\mathcal{J}: \mathcal{P}(\Omega) \to \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ that acts over a small time interval $\Delta t$:
488: 
489: $$
490: \mathcal{J}(\rho) := (1 - \int_\Omega \kappa_{\text{kill}} \rho \cdot \Delta t) \cdot \frac{\rho - \kappa_{\text{kill}} \rho \cdot \Delta t}{\text{(normalization)}} + \mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d] \cdot \Delta t
491: 
492: $$
493: 
494: This operator:
495: 1. **Removes mass** via killing: $\rho \mapsto \rho - \kappa_{\text{kill}} \rho \cdot \Delta t$
496: 2. **Adds mass** via revival: Injects $\mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d] \cdot \Delta t$
497: 3. **Conserves total mass**: $\int \mathcal{J}(\rho) = \int \rho$ (in the two-population model)

483: 
484: :::{prf:definition} Combined Jump Operator
485: :label: def-combined-jump-operator
486: 
487: Define the **jump operator** $\mathcal{J}: \mathcal{P}(\Omega) \to \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ that acts over a small time interval $\Delta t$:
488: 
489: $$
490: \mathcal{J}(\rho) := (1 - \int_\Omega \kappa_{\text{kill}} \rho \cdot \Delta t) \cdot \frac{\rho - \kappa_{\text{kill}} \rho \cdot \Delta t}{\text{(normalization)}} + \mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d] \cdot \Delta t
491: 
492: $$
493: 
494: This operator:
495: 1. **Removes mass** via killing: $\rho \mapsto \rho - \kappa_{\text{kill}} \rho \cdot \Delta t$
496: 2. **Adds mass** via revival: Injects $\mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d] \cdot \Delta t$
497: 3. **Conserves total mass**: $\int \mathcal{J}(\rho) = \int \rho$ (in the two-population model)

items.label: def-qsd-mean-field
items.title: Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD)
items.content:
1438: :label: def-qsd-mean-field
1439: 
1440: A probability measure $\rho_\infty \in \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is a **quasi-stationary distribution** for the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}$ if:
1441: 
1442: 1. **Stationarity**: $\mathcal{L}[\rho_\infty] = 0$
1443: 2. **Normalization**: $\|\rho_\infty\|_{L^1} = M_\infty < 1$ (mass less than 1 due to killing)
items.raw_directive:
1435: ### 0.2. Definition of QSD
1436: 
1437: :::{prf:definition} Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD)
1438: :label: def-qsd-mean-field
1439: 
1440: A probability measure $\rho_\infty \in \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is a **quasi-stationary distribution** for the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}$ if:
1441: 
1442: 1. **Stationarity**: $\mathcal{L}[\rho_\infty] = 0$
1443: 2. **Normalization**: $\|\rho_\infty\|_{L^1} = M_\infty < 1$ (mass less than 1 due to killing)
1444: 3. **Support**: $\text{supp}(\rho_\infty) \subseteq \Omega$ (concentrated on alive region)

items.label: def-modified-fisher
items.title: Modified Fisher Information
items.content:
3946: :label: def-modified-fisher
3947: 
3948: For a parameter $\theta > 0$, the **modified Fisher information** is:
3949: 
3950: $$
3951: I_\theta(\rho) := I_v(\rho) + \theta I_x(\rho) = \int_\Omega \rho \left(|\nabla_v \log \rho|^2 + \theta |\nabla_x \log \rho|^2\right) dx dv
3952: 
3953: $$
